RESTAURANT WEEK OFFER, NOVEMBER 16 - 22.
Three Course Meal for $20.08. Butternut Squash Soup, house made lamb pancetta, Pan-Roasted Atlantic Salmon, braised cabbage & bacon, cippolini onions, Local Pumpkin "Pound Cake", housemade marshmallow & white chocolate ganache.

The Firebox Restaurant, specializing in "contemporary American cuisine," will provide guests with an aesthetically magnificent restaurant, impeccable service, and a menu and wine list that is second to none. The exposed brick, arched windows, 30ft high vaulted ceilings, and original wood beams in the front bar area make it one of the most impressive restaurant spaces in Connecticut, while the back dining room's combination of white-washed brick, warm fireplace, and handmade Amish farm tables make for a remarkable experience. The philosophy at the Firebox is simple; a belief that the best food travels the shortest distance from farm to table, that locally grown ingredients combined with classic technique and innovative thinking make for an enjoyable experience. Starting in July the Firebox will be part of a weekly farmer's market held on the grounds of the restaurant, showcasing the amazing farm products of Connecticut. As a chef, Jason Collin has made a solid commitment to utilize local products whenever possible, recognizing the marvelous natural wealth that the state has to offer.
